column1: # Comments start with a hashtag because of how CSV is read

column3: Resource Description

column1: # ATTN: SUSPENDED AUG 2020 Fenway Health Helpline
column3: Not 24/7! 25+ M-Sa 6pm-11pm ET; <25 M-Sa 5p-11pm. Fenway Health provides information, help, and referrals to LGBT callers. Provide medical and mental health support. They have a Sidney Borum Jr Center that serves LGBTQ+ people 12-29.

column1: # ATTN: Very limited resource Black Trans Travel Fund
column3: An organization that provides Black transgender women in New York and New Jersey with financial and material resources for safer travel options. They offer a monthly literature program.
Toronto-based online community group offering resources and support for the Aboriginal 2-Spirit community. M-F 9:30am-6pm ET.

A comprehensive source of locally curated social services information in the US and Canada. Includes helping find assistance with food, housing, disaster relief, employment, education, veteran services, healthcare, etc.
An international, interdenominational movement of prayer, mission, and justice that hosts non-stop prayer meetings and prayer posts.

column1: 7 Simple Grounding Techniques for Calming Down Quickly
column3: A post on ways to calm down quickly.
A list of 99 different coping skills.
A podcast that hosts interviews with people on the asexual and aromantic. Spectrums.
A public Canvas course on building STEM courses for accessibility.
Information about universal design principles, rights, resources, and accommodations for making STEM more accessible to people with disabilities.
Legal guidance regarding the rights and responsibilities of employers under ADA regarding reasonable accommodations and undue hardship.
A referral service that provides information and resources about addiction,  addiction treatment practitioners, and facilities.
Organization supporting LGBTQIA+ Mormons who are trying to understand their queerness and the church. Has online groups, resources, etc.
A support group for those who are intersex
An organization that provides education and support for people with pain. Their website includes information about clinical trials, conditions and treatments, and pain management.
A means for reflecting on anger triggers and responses.
This book teaches you about depression and about antidepressant skills you can use to manage depression.

AVP empowers lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer, and HIV-affected communities and allies to end all forms of violence through organizing and education, and supports survivors through counseling and advocacy. Has a 24/7 hotline for those who have experienced or witnessed violence personally, or are worried about someone else who has. Also offers support in Spanish.

column1: Anxiety and Depression Association of America Online Resources
column3: Online Resources on a variety of topics regarding to mental health.
A forum to discuss and connect with others about aromanticism.

Digital activities page from Michael O'Mara Books, including a host of online colouring activities, quizzes, and downloadable extras. You can color these 'live' online or print out downloadable pages.
Resources on asexuality, including FAQs for family and friends.
A collection of resources on asexuality.
A database of assistive products for people people with disabilities.
A database of services and resources for autistic individuals and their families.

Awarded to help lesbian, bisexual, transgender, and queer women as well as non-binary and gender nonconforming individuals who have lost family support because of their sexual orientation or gender identity. Applicants must be between 16 and 26 years old and reside in the United States.
A number of apps, extensions, and more that add a color gradient to text that can reduce screen fatigue and increase reading speed. Prices are clearly labeled, and they offer a student discount.
Free, online support groups for patients and caregivers managing any kind of disability or illness.
A community that affirms that ALL people are worthy of G-d's love, with resources for finding affirming faith communities.
A wealth of useful information about OCD, its symptoms, effects, treatments, and more.
Resources for helping graduate students and people with PhDs have meaningful careers in industry, non-profits, higher education administration, faculty, and the private sector.

column1: Birth Control Across the Gender Spectrum
column3: A PDF guide comparing and contrasting different birth control methods using gender-inclusive language.

column1: Birthing and Breast or Chestfeeding Trans People and Allies
column3: Facebook group with information and experiences about pregnancy, birth, and nursing among trans and genderfluid/neutral people.

column1: Black Emotional and Mental Health Collective
column3: Resources, tool kits, and training dedicated to the emotional and mental health and healing of Black communities.

column1: Black Trans COVID-19 Community Response Grant
column3: Micro grants for trans people of color.

column1: Black Trans Free COVID-19 Care Packages
column3: Care packages with personal protective equipment for trans people of color.
Converts from common file formats to more accessible file formats, including electronic braille and Beeline Reader.
A 24/7 hotline dedicated to people in crisis or who have an interaction with law enforcement or vigilantes.
Audio-based meditations for healing racial trauma and cultivating an anti-racist mindset by Dr. Candice Nicole.

Provides resources, support, and celebration to the bi+ community (bisexual, pansexual, and queer). Offers a number of brochures and tips on coming out, sexual and mental health, inclusion, and intersectionality.
A free resource and counseling service that assists youth and parents 24/7. Offers support in Spanish and over 100 other languages through interpretation services.
A website with recipes for cooking and meal prepping on a budget.
A free PDF of the Good and Cheap cookbook translated into Spanish. This cookbook is for eating well on less than $4 per day.
Statewide initiative that aims to support and retain underrepresented undergraduates to achieve their degrees in the biological sciences, physical sciences, mathematics, and engineering.

Calm Harm iprovides tasks to help you resist or manage the urge to self-harm. Calm Harm is an app developed for teenage mental health using the basic principles of an evidence-based therapy called Dialectical Behavioral Therapy (DBT).
Programs and services to create safer, more inclusive college campuses.
Information about making funeral arrangements after the death of a loved one, and provides a timeline and links to resources.
Network of LGBTQ+ community centers. They have a map for finding local support.
Publishes the guidelines people should adhere to and maintains up-to-date information about current health threats.

column1: Changing Lives by Integrating Mind and Body (CLIMB) Podcast
column3: A podcast that helps to incorporate mindfulness and stress management in your everyday life. Available in English and Spanish
Government site for finding state-specific local resources on child care, health and social services, financial assistance, support for children with special needs, and more.
A 24/7, free and confidential hotline for child abuse victims, parents, and concerned individuals serving the US and Canada. They support interpretation for 170 languages.
A clearinghouse for information on ADHD and offers support and advocacy.
Organization that provides mentorship, open-access resources on scholarships, fellowships and blog posts on professional development to undergraduate, graduate, and professional students.

column1: Científico Latino Graduate Student Mentorship Initiative
column3: A mentorship program intended to connect underrepresented students applying to graduate programs with STEM professionals that have been through the graduate school process.

column1: COLAGE: Children of Lesbians and Gays Everywhere
column3: An organization that supports LGBTQ+ caregivers and provides a network of peers and supporters.
Resources for LGBTQ+ specific scholarships, tips for determining if a college is LGBTQ+ friendly, and more.
Free, all-ages coloring books featuring PhD research in science and engineering.
Book about exploring identity and think through how to share their identities with others.
A member-based organization by the LGBT Resource Professionals working towards the liberation of LGBTQ people in higher education
A PDF on ways to cope with gender dysphoria.
Screening tool for COVID-19 symptoms based on CDC guidelines and gives recommendations for care.
Free online courses in a variety of subjects. Also pairs with universities for paid degree programs.

Crisis Text Line is a global not-for-profit organization providing free confidential crisis intervention via SMS message. The organization's services are available 24 hours a day, every day, throughout the US, UK, and Canada
Legal information and resources for victims of online abuses, such as non-consensual pornography and recorded sexual assault. Maintains a 24/7 crisis helpline with interpretation available.
Support groups of a variety of topics including mental health, health, and LGBTQ.

column1: Dance Workout: Tribute to Black Lives
column3: This dance workout is an outlet for healing, empowerment, love and celebration.
Dialectical Behavioral Therapy (DBT) activity to complete after self-harm and borderline personality disorder episodes. Used to identify triggers and gain insight into how to alter behavior patterns.

Dialectical Behavioral Therapy (DBT) worksheet to complete after self-harm and borderline personality disorder episodes. Used to identify triggers and gain insight into how to alter behavior patterns.
An affirmation movement for Black women by Black women. They have a daily affirmation text program.
A resource database for demisexuality.
Mental health resources during COVID-19.
A free PDF cookbook of healthful meals that are accessible to the budgets of people with chronic illnesses living on SNAP (roughly $4/day).
A text line for discussing work issues with trained peer counselors. Website also features a web-based chat.

Identifies and recruits students with apparent and non-apparent disabilities who are majoring in science, engineering, mathematics, computer science, and some fields of business for internship and co-op opportunities
A resource of statuses of LGBT rights and topics around the world
A PDF of lab equipment and products compiled by UC Santa Cruz for accommodating people with disabilities in the lab.
Familia: Trans Queer Liberation Movement works to achieve the liberation of trans, queer, and gender non-conforming Latinx people.
An organization that provides free food assistance to veterans and their families.
Search for free or reduced cost services like medical care, food, job training, and more. Formerly known as Aunt Bertha.
Resource guide for people who are looking for mental health help for someone else.
A fellowship program aimed at increasing diversity at the faculty-level. Awards are at the pre-doctoral, dissertation, and post-doctoral stages.
Directory of surgeons and describes differences between surgical procedures for trans masculine folks.

column1: Future Docs with Disabilities Mentoring Program
column3: Rolling mentorship program for people with disabilities wanting to become physicians.

Annual surgery and HRT grant program for trans people with solicitations in both English and Spanish. Currently has online support gatherings for trans youth, trans people 18+, trans people 40+, and parents of trans kids.
column4: LGBTQ, gender identity, health, aid, parent

column3: A comprehensive collection of research, resources, and stories to help any parent, family member, or guardian learn more about gender diversity.
UK charity for single parent families providing advice and support, as well as an online forum.
Information for reporting on and supporting people, including LGBTQ+ terms, information on current issues, and more. Web-based version has a link to a PDF version.
LGBTQIA+ resource list classified by various topics, including: politics, sexual orientation, gender identity, military, legal, etc.
A note-taking tool that can combine slides, audio recordings, and text in one place. Offers a free, unlimited access trial, and includes pricing information in their FAQ.
A safe and empowering online space for womxn, QTBIPOC+, and LGBTQIA+ communities.
A free PDF cookbook for eating well on less than $4 per day.
Prescription prices, coupons, and pharmacy information.
A Google Chrome browser extension that alters webpages to mask a former name/dead name.
An virtual writing group for graduate students and post-doctoral students. The community also has discussions on mental health, self-care, motivation, goal setting, and accountability.
A list of fellowships maintained by Johns Hopkins and includes deadlines and eligibility.
A list of STEM graduate programs choosing not to require GRE scores for admission.
An open-source guide to being an ally to any community.
A free habit-forming and productivity app (web, iOS, and Android) that gamifies tasks. Also offers paid group plans with pricing information listed on their website.
Social support network and resources for processing grief and honoring loved ones and pets.
Information on insurance coverage and discrimination for transition-related care.
Evidence-based self-help articles on a variety of topics including communication, mental health, relationships, family, aging, and wellness.
Information about government programs for temporary assistance.
Information for free assistance with US tax return preparation.
Website and desktop app that offers suggestions for improving language and writing and assesses the reading level of written works.
Inclusive, secular UK-based organization supporting LGBTQI+ Muslims and promoting social justice.
Information on behaviors that increase or decrease HIV transmission risk.
Government resource that provides HIV resources, programs and federal policies to the American public

column1: Holiday Self-Care Tips for LGBTQ+ People
column3: Six self-care tips for LGBTQ+ people during the winter months.
A resource to help locate local homeless shelters and service organizations.

column1: How to Stay Calm During a Coronavirus Outbreak
column3: Information on protecting yourself, managing anxiety, and setting realistic expectations.
A guide on how to support bisexual youth or young people who are attracted to more than one gender.

column1: How to Support Someone with Suicidal Thoughts
column3: Thorough support information, including an instructional section toward the bottom on "How can I help someone who is feeling suicidal?" and resources for those in the UK.

column1: HRC State maps of laws and policies
column3: All LGBTQIA+ laws / policies broken down by state.
A database divided by state of scholarships for LGBTQ+ undergraduate & graduate students.
Topical information and provides scores for states and county legal protection of LGBTQ+ individuals.
A tumblr blog with resources and blog posts from and by LGBTQIA+ Muslims

column1: I'm Muslim And My Gender Doesn't Fit Me: A Resource For Trans Muslim Youth
column3: A book for transgender Muslim youth about understanding gender and religious identity.
World maps that highlight different legal restrictions for LGBTQ+ people.

column1: ILGA World- the International Lesbian, Gay, Bixexual, Trans and Intersex Assoication
column3: A worldwide federation that advocates for LGBT rights and provides resources on LGBT laws and issues around the world
The world's leading network of LGBTQ welcoming tourism businesses that provides travel resources and information.
Online directory of professionals that affirm all intersectional identities and strive to be anti-discrimination, anti-oppression, anti-stigma, anti-racist & anti-ableist.
An interactive map to find Indian Health Service, Tribal or Urban Indian Health Program facilities.
Free meditation app (iOS and Android) for sleep, anxiety, and stress. Also has free yoga courses.
A 24/7 mental health hotline with crisis support.
Organization that advocates for intersex youth and provides resources for intersex people.
An interactive flow chart for people who struggle with self care, executive dysfunction, and/or who have trouble reading internal signals.
Provides resources about bipolar disorder.
A list of mobile apps for managing OCD that have been scored for credibility, data transparency, cost, and availability.

column1: Interpersonal Effectiveness in Dialectical Behavior Therapy
column3: Information on better interpersonal communication skils, including DEAR MAN, GIVE, and FAST methods.
Over 1100 organizations in 40+ countries supporting the LGBTQ+ community.
An REU program that integrates Deaf, hearing, and sign language interpreting students in chemical research.
Example ADA accomodations and resources for a more accessible workplace.
Organization for LGBTQ+ equality in Jewish life.
Organization for LGBTQ+ equality in Jewish life in the UK.
A gamified site with high-quality educational videos for a variety of courses. Also offers test-prep resources for the LSAT, Praxis, and MCAT.
A safe spiritual and social community to former and current lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and intersex Seventh-day Adventists, their families, and those who support them.
Provides information about legal rights for LGBTQIA+ people and their families on a national and state-by-state basis.
Directory of Latinx therapists with  options to search by cultural identity, specialty, and accepted insurance.
Information from the US Office on Women's Health on the things to consider when fleeing an abusive relationship or domestic violence. Includes a list of important items to pack.
Subscription-based audiobooks for people with documented print disabilities (e.g., learning, visual). Fees are clearly marked on their site.

column1: Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual and Transgender Foreign Travel Advice
column3: Resources and advice for LGBT tourists travelling abroad by the UK government
A daily meditation app by and for Black people. Liberate is free on iOS and Android and offers a premium subscription service with prices listed on their site.
Resource with weekly virtual eating disorder support groups for queer and BIPOC people at sliding scale cost ($5 - $20).
Provides a vet-to-vet helpline for veterans and their families.
Organization that provides evidence-based training on mental health and suicide prevention.
A directory of LGBT community centers within CenterLink.
CDC's page on LGBT health that lists resources and clinics by state.
A Facebook group for LGBTQ+ dog lovers to chat, rant, and commiserate. Supportive place for those mourning the loss of a dog.

column1: LL - Updating and Amending School Records
column3: An FAQ on how FERPA requires schools to keep accurate records, enabling transgender students to update their information after a legal name/gender marker change, even after graduated.
Loosid is an app for community-building among sober people, and for support with sobriety.
Hotline and website for information and resources on teen and young adult relationship violence and abuse. They have resources pertaining to Title IX violations.
Tips for coping after being affected by a mass shooting.
An online community and podcast that aims to destigmatize South Asian mental health issues, improve awareness, and promote self-care.
A Black church movement for gay and transgender justice. Some of their resources include blessings and affirming rituals.

column1: Map of All US Informed Consent Clinics
column3: A crowd-sourced map of all the US clinics offering informed consent for hormone replacement therapy (HRT).
A web-based math assistance program created by Chegg. Offers support for pre-algebra through calculus, statistics, and linear algebra.
Pill reminder app for both Android and iOS. The app can also warn about potential drug interactions and give refill reminders. The paid version removes banner ads.
Mental Health First Aid is a skills-based training course that teaches participants about mental health and substance-use issues.
A mentorship program intended to connect underrepresented students to STEM professionals sharing their identities.

Organization supporting transgender, non-binary, and gender-diverse youth in the UK. Their site maintains a resource list about all things gender transition. They have a helpline and webchat on M-F 9a-9p BT.

column1: MHA - Talking to Your Parents About Mental Health
column3: Guidance for overcoming some comment statements that people use to avoid discussing mental health with family members.
A 3-year fellowship for underrepresented PhD students, explicitly including LGBTQ+ identities.
A website with resources on funding, fellowships, mentoring, and diversity issues for upcoming and current post-doctoral scholars.
Offers internships to help develop our future workforce in critically important areas of science, engineering, technology, and mathematics (STEM).

column1: Minority University Research and Education Project (MUREP)
column3: Enhance the research, academic and technology capabilities of MSIs through multiyear cooperative agreements.
A non-profit organization that advances fairness and equality for the LGBTQ military and veteran community
A guide to polyamory and ethical non-monogamy in relationships.
A simplified process for determining food stamp qualification and registration.
Directory of surgeons and describes differences between surgical procedures for trans feminine folks.

column1: Muslim Alliance for Sexual and Gender Diversity
column3: A working group to support, empower and connect LGBTQ Muslims.
Map of local mutual aid networks and food resources.

MY3 is an app for individuals who may be having thoughts of suicide, or who have a history of suicidal behavior. It is designed to help these individuals stay safe during when they are experiencing thoughts of suicide.
A guided meditation app for both Android and iOS. Check in with how you're feeling, and try short activities tuned to your emotions. Offers premium content for a fee.
A free web-based career planning tool tailored for PhD students and post-docs to help users develop and individual development plan.
A tool to help with safety decisions if you, or someone you care about, is experiencing abuse in their intimate relationship. *Includes LGBTQIA+ relationships.
Online directory of trans-affirming healthcare providers.
A website where users can change set their own optimal background noise (or use preset values) to help them focus and tune out distractions.
What to do if you're pulled over by the police.
Scholarships for underrepresented minority students in engineering and computer science.
Information on mental illness symptoms, seeking help, education, and mental health advocacy. Helpline Hours: M-F 10am-6pm ET
Directories for protest support bail funds and community-led bail and bond funds for pretrial and immigration bail.

column1: National Center for Transgender Equality: Know Your Rights
column3: The NCTE's topic-based legal information, including for employment, health care, housing, and immigration.
The National Domestic Violence Hotline is a 24-hour confidential service for survivors, victims and those affected by domestic violence, intimate partner violence and relationship abuse.
A 24/7 crisis hotline for graduate students.
An organization that advances for the full freedom, justice, and equality for LGBTQ people through action
A helpline to assist in becoming an empowered and stronger parent. Hours: M-F 1pm ET - 10pm ET.

column1: National Queer and Trans Therapists of Color Network
column3: NQTTCN maintains an online directory of queer and trans therapists of color that provide mental health services for other queer and trans people of color.

column1: National Resource Center on LGBT Aging
column3: Resources on aging and relevant topics for LGBT people.
A 24/7 non-judgmental hotline for runaway, homeless and at-risk youth and their families at their most vulnerable moments.
The National Sexual Assault Hotline is a 24-hour confidential service for survivors of sexual assault.
The Lifeline provides 24/7, free and confidential support for people in distress, prevention and crisis resources for you or your loved ones, and best practices for professionals.
A legal organization dedicated to defending the rights of Native American tribes, organizations, and people.
Information about applying for prescription assistance programs and additional information about affording medications.
Information about non-binary neutrois gender identities.
A non-judgmental hotline for people taking drugs to call as a safeguard against accidental overdose.

column1: NIH Postbaccalaureate Research Education Program (PREP) Program
column3: A research-focused program for underrepresented individuals in the biomedical sciences who are interested in pursuing a research-focused doctoral degrees. The program actively seeks to create opportunities for people with disabilities.

he NOAA EPP/MSI Undergraduate Scholarship provides funds for two years of undergraduate study to rising junior undergraduate students majoring in STEM fields that directly support NOAA's mission. Participants conduct research at a NOAA facility during two paid summer internships. Only U.S. citizens and U.S. nationals attending Minority Serving Institutions as defined by the US Department of Education are eligible to apply.
STEM scholarships for undergraduate & graduate students who are LGBTQ+ or active allies.

column1: Northwest Portland Area Indian Health Board (NPAIHB) Text Line
column2: Text LGBTQ2S to 97779 to receive resources via text message.
column3: Text to learn more about Two Spirit and LGBTQ+ Health.
Skills and support for coping with suicidal thoughts based on Dialectical Behavior Therapy.
Site that lists all active NSF-funded Research Experience for Undergraduates (REU) programs.
A Google Doc of different open-access materials for lab courses.
Online directory for finding local, affordable counseling.
Online Library with free book downloads.
A directory of affinity groups (community support groups) where people can meet and discuss experiences with others that share a similar identity.

This is the application for our oSTEM Community Relief Emergency Fund. This fund is to help our community with any urgent financial needs due to housing insecurity and limited resources during this public health crisis.
Additional resources in response to COVID-19 compiled by oSTEM volunteers.
A list of oSTEM resources in response to COVID-19. Includes the oSTEM response statement, Crisis Text Line, oSTEM Squad Slack, Emergency Fund Application, Event Calendar, and other resources.
A list of LGBTQIA+ support resources, including crisis hotlines and other services.
A professional Discord server for oSTEM's community to have discussions and be social.

column1: oSTEM Pronouns and Why They Matter
column3: This guide is designed to be shared with those who may not be familiar with pronouns and the different pronouns that people might use.
oSTEM's virtual community which includes a multitude of resources and channels. Meeting place for the oSTEM affinity groups (community support groups).
A Q&A-style book for families of lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, gender-expansive, and queer youth and adults.
A Q&A-style book about transgender and gender expansive people for parents, families, and friends.
A list of LGBTQ+ healthcare resources in the United States. Includes resources for primary care, mental health services, youth groups, shelters, support groups, and STI testing.
A messaging app where members of the LGBTQ community in STEM can join and connect with each other.
10-week program designed primarily for college juniors and seniors who want to spend a summer gaining practical experience in marine and environmental science.
Directory of programs, internships, and fellowships for those in STEM at any career stage.
A data-driven online community for sharing stories and information about health conditions, symptoms, and treatments.

The PEACE Wellness Collective was created by 5 Black women whose goal is to provide mental health and wellness resources to the black community. They offer therapy for individuals, family, and couples.
English and Spanish CDC fact sheet on post-exposure prophylaxis (PEP) [start within 3 days after HIV exposure].
Provides LGBTQIA+ community and their loved ones with information, tools, resources, advocacy, education, and support.
An online community that focuses on empowering graduate students.
An online community for academic parents and carers for moral support, encouragement, and advice.
Articles, blog posts, and resources for preparing for, applying to, and succeeding in graduate school. Also offers thesis and dissertation-phase advice and tips for after graduate school.
A support line staffed by psychiatrists to help US medical students and physicians navigate the intersections of their personal and professional lives. Available 7 days a week, 8:00AM - 1:00AM ET
Reproductive healthcare. Many offer HRT for trans people.
National LGBTQ+ scholarship fund for "out" undergraduate and graduate students
Offers a lot of transition-related funding/services, such as a chest binder donation program and trans feminine shapewear program.
Funding for trans people to cover trans community needs.
Poison control is a 24/7 hotline with information on poison emergencies.
12 step program for overcoming porn addition -- steps involve G-d.
English and Spanish CDC fact sheet on pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP).
LGBTQ+ health care education -- clinical articles and resources.
A sex guide for trans men into men (explicit).
An app (Android and iOS) that can manage a personal budget and keep track of paychecks and bill schedules.
A Facebook group for people who love purebred animals. Supportive place for those mourning the loss of a pet.
Online forum for queer people of Christian faiths.

column1: QTBIPOC Eating Disorder Facebook Support Group
column3: A supportive space for queer and trans Black, Indigenous, and people of color (QTBIPOC) who struggle with eating disorders (EDs).
Online, sliding scale access to HRT, gender-marker changes, PrEP, birth control, STI/STD testing, surgery, and mental health for trans individuals.
Suicide prevention training for individuals and organizations.
Connect trans, gender non-conforming, intersex, and queer individuals to comprehensive care in order to improve individual and community health.
A non-profit organization to establish and maintain a society of Def GLBT to encourange and promote their educational, economical, and social welfare.
An online support community for those grieving a pet loss. The community observes a weekly candle lighting ceremony and offers space for a virtual pet memorial.
Workbook for partners of trans folx.
This fact sheet offers information about reproductive options for trans people interested in hormone therapy or surgeries.

column3: RESESS supports interns in summer research experiences at UNAVCO in Boulder, CO, as well as provides professional development opportunities and graduate school application support.

column1: Resource for Parents and Families of LGBTQ Individuals
column3: A PDF of resources for parents and families of LGBTQ individuals.
An organization that provides free binders to UK individuals 16+ who need them.
An infographic about safely planning for and participating in protests.
A 24/7 UK-based suicide hotline that provides services to the UK, Ireland, Scotland, and Wales.

column3: A resource guide about supporting LGBT children.
Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration offers a 24/7 hotline to support people experiencing emotional distress related to natural or human-caused disasters.

Downloadable PDF that includes a directory submitted by Lori King (Project Director at Tribal Tech, LLC) and Margaret Springe (Deputy Project Manager, Tribal Tech, LLC). There are several Two-Spirit specific resources.
SAMHSA offers a 24/7 hotline for treatment referral and information on mental and/or substance abuse disorders. Spanish also available.
An REU (Research Experience for Undergraduates) program for students with disabilities studying chemistry, biochemistry, or related fields, hosted at the University of Delaware.
A list of potential coping/distraction techniques separated out by the motivation behind self-harm.
An app (iOS and Android) with resources for building a person's anxiety toolkit.
12 step program for overcoming sex addiction -- steps involve G-d.
Sex education by teens, for teens.
A technique built for people with dyslexia and dyscalculia for doing written and mental math problems. Offers a free trial and have individual and site licenses.

column3: Undergraduate-to-graduate bridge program designed to broaden participation of historically underrepresented communities in the atmospheric and related sciences.
A non-profit organization providing information and resources about self-injury to people who self-injure, have recovered, or want to help.
Information about setting up an iPhone shortcut that texts a contact alerting them you've been pulled over and starts recording using the iPhone's front-facing camera.
A homework help website with step-by-step solutions and a forum for asking questions.
Self-help program for addiction recovery

column1: Small Steps to Increase Physical Activity
column3: A PDF with 35 small ways to add physical activities into your regular routines.
An app (iOS and Android) for identifying one's personal transition goals and making a plan to attain them.
SPART*A is a group of transgender people who currently serve or have served in the military.
Resources for autistic students transitioning from high school to college and enrolled in STEM courses.

An organization that offers innovative advice and support services for all people experiencing estrangement by providing support groups, therapeutic workshops, and connections with people for ongoing emotional support

Support groups for parents of transgender children and trans youth aged 9-22. Also maintains a phone-based support network of Ally Parents that trans*/non-binary/gender-queer or questioning people, as well as parents, can contact for support and affirmation.
A recruitment agency and job board for students and graduates in STEM fields in the UK.

column1: Straight for Equality: be not afraid
column3: A pdf about how to be supportive to those in the GLBT community within faith communities.
UK-based charity that campaigns for the equality of LGBTQ+ people across Britain and abroad.
An anonymous and confidential helpline for American Indians and Alaska Natives focusing on safe, domestic, dating and sexual violence. 8am-11pm ET

column1: Summer Research & Prof Development for UndocuSTEM
column3: A list of opportunities available to undocumented students.
Helpline run by LGBTQ+ people in the UK to discuss anything, including sexuality, gender identity, sexual health and emotional wellbeing. Hours: Su-Sa 10:00-22:00 BT.
Legal-aid organization serving low-income or people of color that are transgender, intersex, or gender non-conforming.
An organization that supports mental health in Punjabi communities and includes resources in Punjabi.
Teen Lifeline's hotline has been a connection of hope for teens in crisis.

A confidential and anonymous help line for teens. They offer text and call support through the same number, and their website has a chat feature. Hours: M-F evenings 5pm ET-1am ET, Sa/Su 9pm ET-1am ET.
A crowdfunded organization providing cash relief to trans and gender nonconforming individuals for help with medical costs.

column1: The Body Is Not an Apology
column3: Digital media and education organization run by queer Black women, promotes radical self love, articles about mental illness and disability and sexuality and everything else.
The gender unicorn is a graphic that visually distinguishes the following terms: gender identity, gender expression, sex assigned at birth, physical attraction, and emotional attraction.
An annual review about the rights and advancement of Indigenous peoples throughout the world.

The LGBT National Help Center provides telephone, online chat, and email peer-support. They speak with callers of all ages about bullying, workplace issues, HIV/AIDS anxiety, coming out, relationships, safer sex, and more.
A digital community for people to discuss health challenges, including chronic illnesses and disabilities.
A program that seeks to address the global crisis faced by Black Trans people by bringing home cooked, healthy, and culturally specific meals and resources to Black Trans People.

column1: The Nina Pop and Tony McDade Free Therapy Fund: CARE LANES
column3: An emergency mutal aid program by The Okra Project that gives Black Trans Community Members free access to appointments with qualified Black therapists.
A doctoral support group that has an online study room, similar to working virtually in a library.

column1: The U.S. Department of State travel advisory for LGBTI travelers
column3: General information and tips for LGBT people who are travelling outside of the United States.
Free therapy worksheets related to habit forming, CBT, self-esteem, anger, ADHD, managing emotions, and more.
Resource list for finding free and low-cost mental health support created by 3 PhD students in mental health fields.
Directory of therapists and a podcast supporting the mental wellness of Black women and girls. Also offers a subscription-based online community.

column1: Therapy for Queer People of Color (QPOC)
column3: Directory of therapists across the US with affirming care for Queer People of Color.
Free online support community offers members a convenient and safe place to connect. Groups for: Addicion, Anxiety, Depression, HIV/AIDS,  LGBTQ+, Marriage/Family, OCD, and Teens.
Books about a range of topics. Includes children's titles.

column1: THRIVE Lifeline List of STEMM Organizations
column3: A collection of STEMM organizations and societies.
A directory where students can looks for mental health services in their area.
Information from the NIH about navigating an undiganosed medical condition. Provides connections to advocacy groups and funding.
Directory of surgeons and describes differences between surgical procedures for trans masculine folks.
List of trans-competent providers and support groups for transgender and gender-diverse people fighting eating disorders. Also offers training resources for healthcare providers.
A guide to the language of gender, sexuality, accessibility, and acceptance.

A 24/7 hotline available in the U.S. and Canada staffed by transgender people for transgender people. Trans Lifeline is primarily for transgender people in a crisis, from struggling with gender identity to thoughts of self-harm. Also offers support in Spanish.
Microgrants intended to help fund legal name and gender marker changes.

column1: Trans Masculine and LGBTQ+ Support Groups
column3: A monthly support group for trans masculine folks that are 18+ and a monthly support group for 18+ LGBTQ+ folks who meet and discuss that month's topic. There are two times each month to accommodate different schedules. ASL interpreters will be present for the entire meeting, and rev.com's automatic closed captioning will also be turned on.

A service providing free and sterile HRT needle supplies to trans folk in the US who cannot access or afford their own. Trans Needles prioritizes the needs of Black Trans people. They also provide harm reduction supplies, such as Narcan and menstrual products.
Liturgy and educational resources for supporting Jewish people of all genders.
An info hub, safe haven, and support system for transgender people and their family, friends, and allies.
TransFamily Support Services guides transgender/non-binary youth and their families through the gender transitioning process to help make it the most positive experience possible.
A PDF booklet containing text and image-based descriptions of how to use injectable medication.
Publications and resources offering information on the more common legal challenges and questions transgender people encounter.

TLDEF's Name Change Project provides pro bono legal name change services to low-income transgender, gender non-conforming, and non-binary people through partnerships with some of the nation's most prestigious law firms and corporate law departments.

column1: Trevor - Guide to Being an Ally for T/Enby Youth
column3: A guide for supporting trans and non-binary youth.
Some commonly asked questions from queer believers about faith and LGBTQ+ identities, plus a few resource links.

A 24/7 non-judgmental hotline with LGBTQ-sensitive trained counselors you can contact through a call, text, or chat during a mental health crisis and/or suicidal thoughts. Available in the United States.
Connects LGBTQIA+ youth to peer support and community through online forums, hosted by the Trevor Project. Must be 13-24, must provide email address to join.

column1: True Colors LGBT Youth Homelessness 101 Course
column3: A free, online course that covers oppression, facts about LGBTQ youth homelessness, gender pronouns, unique experiences of transgender youth, and creating inclusive environments.

column1: True Colors Sexual Minority Youth and Family Services Resources
column3: Resouces on LGBT topics.
Online transgender and non-binary informed consent clinic serving patients in AZ, CO, IA, ID, ME, MD, MT, NM, NV, OR, and WA. Costs are clearly listed on their website.
Information for trans feminine and non-binary folks on how to tuck and tucking safety.

column1: Two-Spirit /LGBTQ+ Native Americans in Higher Education Resource Guide
column3: Downloadable PDF of resources of Native Americans and LGBT people.
Downloadable PDF that includes a directory prepared by Harlan Pruden (Nehiyawe/First Nations Cree), Managing Editor of the Two-Spirit Journal.
Podcasts recorded by Margaret Robinson during a post-doctoral fellowship in Aboriginal Methodologies.

A 24/7 program by the national Safe Place initiative. Text the word "SAFE" and your current location (address, city, state) to 4HELP (44357). They will reply with the location of the closest Safe Place site and the phone number for a local youth agency. You can reply with "2CHAT" to text interactively with a trained counselor.

The UCAR Next Generation Fellowships provide financial support for graduate students from underrepresented communities for two years of graduate school and the opportunity to spend two summers in internships with the National Center for Atmospheric Research (NCAR) and the University Corporation for Atmospheric Research (UCAR). The program offers three distinctive tracks: Earth System Science, Diversity & Inclusion, and Public Policy.

column1: UCSF Center of Excellence for Transgender Health
column3: Educational resources, best practices, and guidelines for transgender medicine.
Information about different mental health conditions, advice for helping a friend, and local resources. Also offers a self-evaluator tool for mental illness screenings.
A blog with resources for joining and thriving in a research group.
Organization with tools and resource guides for people covered by DACA (DREAMers).
A browser extension that can find free and legal copies of journal articles and academic works published behind a paywall.
This iOS app helps you learn skills related to mood and anxiety, from journals, to navigating triggers and more.
A categorical resource list pertaining to pain management, including population specific resources.
An app (iOS and Android) that delivers a new Bible verse each day with commentary.
A crisis hotline for veterans and those who are concerned about one. Text is also available.
Provides service dogs and canine therapy services to veterans with physical and/or mental health challenges.

column1: VSchool - You Belong in Tech Scholarship
column3: A 100% tuition paid scholarship program for online web development and UX/UI design programs available for people of color, women, LGBTQ+, refugees, veterans, and those in financial hardships.
An app-based (iOS and Android) social community for fostering hope, direction, and healing for people with chronic and invisible health conditions.

column1: Washington Internships for Students of Engineering (WISE)
column3: Students discover how government officials make decisions on complex technological issues, while also learning how engineers and scientists can contribute to the legislative process and regulatory decision-making
Resources by Native youth for Native youth on a wide range of topics.
Free app (iOS/Android) for conversations and cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT).
Resources for survivors, employers, coworkers, and advocates on workplace domestic violence, sexual assault, sexual harassment, and stalking.
Addresses health topics to inform individuals.

column1: World Professional Association for Transgender Health
column3: WPATH has resources, publications, and news about transgender health.
A website with a list of yoga poses to boost feel-good endorphins for depression.
